questionsSolved.userSolution:
SELECT CONCAT(first_name, ' ', last_name) AS full_name
FROM patients;

SELECT first_name, last_name, height
FROM patients
ORDER BY height DESC
LIMIT 1;

SELECT COUNT(*) AS total_admissions
FROM admissions;

SELECT patient_id, COUNT(*) AS total_admissions
FROM admissions
WHERE patient_id = 579
GROUP BY patient_id;

SELECT first_name, last_name, allergies
FROM patients
WHERE allergies IS NOT NULL
AND city = 'Hamilton';

SELECT first_name
FROM patients
GROUP BY first_name
HAVING COUNT(first_name) = 1;

SELECT patient_id, first_name
FROM patients
WHERE first_name LIKE 's%' 
  AND first_name LIKE '%s'
  AND LENGTH(first_name) >= 6;

SELECT p.patient_id, p.first_name, p.last_name
FROM patients p
JOIN admissions a ON p.patient_id = a.patient_id
WHERE a.diagnosis = 'Dementia';

SELECT patient_id,diagnosis
FROM admissions
GROUP BY patient_id,diagnosis
HAVING COUNT(*) > 1;

SELECT city, COUNT(*) AS total_patients
FROM patients
GROUP BY city
ORDER BY total_patients DESC, city ASC;

SELECT patient_id, attending_doctor_id, diagnosis
FROM admissions
WHERE 
    (MOD(patient_id, 2) = 1 AND attending_doctor_id IN (1, 5, 19))
    OR 
    (attending_doctor_id LIKE '%2%' AND LENGTH(patient_id) = 3);

SELECT *
FROM admissions
WHERE patient_id = 542
ORDER BY admission_date DESC
LIMIT 1;

SELECT first_name, last_name, allergies
FROM patients
WHERE allergies IN ('Penicillin', 'Morphine')
ORDER BY allergies ASC, first_name ASC, last_name ASC;

SELECT allergies, COUNT(*) AS allergy_count
FROM patients
WHERE allergies IS NOT NULL
GROUP BY allergies
ORDER BY allergy_count DESC;

SELECT DAY(admission_date) AS day_of_month, COUNT(*) AS admission_count
FROM admissions
WHERE admission_date IS NOT NULL
GROUP BY day_of_month
ORDER BY admission_count DESC;

SELECT first_name, last_name, birth_date
FROM patients
WHERE birth_date BETWEEN '1970-01-01' AND '1979-12-31'
ORDER BY birth_date ASC;

SELECT province_id, SUM(height) AS total_height
FROM patients
GROUP BY province_id
HAVING SUM(height) >= 7000;

SELECT
    COUNT(CASE WHEN gender = 'Male' THEN 1 END) AS male_count,
    COUNT(CASE WHEN gender = 'Female' THEN 1 END) AS female_count
FROM patients;

SELECT 
    d.doctor_id,
    CONCAT(d.first_name, ' ', d.last_name) AS doctor_full_name,
    d.specialty,
    strftime('%Y', a.admission_date) AS year,      COUNT(patient_id) AS total_admissions
FROM 
    doctors d
JOIN 
    admissions a ON d.doctor_id = attending_doctor_id
GROUP BY 
    d.doctor_id, 
    d.first_name, 
    d.last_name, 
    d.specialty, 
    year
ORDER BY 
    d.doctor_id, 
    year;

SELECT province_name
FROM province_names
ORDER BY 
    CASE 
        WHEN province_name = 'Ontario' THEN 0
        ELSE 1
    END,
    province_name ASC;

WITH DailyAdmissions AS (
    SELECT 
        DATE(admission_date) AS admission_date,
        COUNT(patient_id) AS admission_count
    FROM 
        admissions
    GROUP BY 
        DATE(admission_date)
)

SELECT 
    admission_date,
    admission_count,
    admission_count - LAG(admission_count, 1, 0) OVER (ORDER BY admission_date) AS admission_count_change
FROM 
    DailyAdmissions
ORDER BY 
    admission_date;

SELECT  
    ROUND(100 * COUNT(CASE WHEN gender = 'M' THEN 1 END) / CAST(COUNT(*) AS FLOAT), 2) || '%' AS male_percentage
FROM 
    patients;

SELECT *
FROM patients
WHERE 
    first_name LIKE '__r%' 
    AND gender = 'F' 
    AND MONTH(birth_date) IN (2, 5, 12) 
    AND weight BETWEEN 60 AND 80 
    AND patient_id % 2 = 1 
    AND city = 'Kingston';

SELECT 
    pn.province_name
FROM 
    patients p
JOIN 
    province_names pn ON p.province_id = pn.province_id
GROUP BY 
    pn.province_name
HAVING 
    COUNT(CASE WHEN p.gender = 'M' THEN 1 END) > COUNT(CASE WHEN p.gender = 'F' THEN 1 END);

SELECT  
    CASE 
        WHEN patient_id % 2 = 0 THEN 'Yes' 
        ELSE 'No' 
    END AS has_insurance, 
    SUM(CASE 
        WHEN patient_id % 2 = 0 THEN 10 
        ELSE 50 
    END) AS total_cost 
FROM 
    admissions 
GROUP BY 
    has_insurance;

SELECT 
    p.patient_id, 
    p.patient_id || LENGTH(last_name) || strftime('%Y', birth_date) AS temp_password 
FROM 
    patients p 
WHERE 
    p.patient_id IN ( 
        SELECT DISTINCT(patient_id) 
        FROM admissions 
    );

SELECT 
    p.patient_id, 
    p.first_name, 
    p.last_name, 
    d.specialty 
FROM 
    patients p 
JOIN 
    admissions a ON p.patient_id = a.patient_id 
JOIN 
    doctors d ON a.attending_doctor_id = d.doctor_id 
WHERE 
    a.diagnosis = 'Epilepsy' 
    AND d.first_name = 'Lisa';

SELECT 
    patient_id, 
    weight, 
    height, 
    CASE 
        WHEN (weight / ((height / 100.0) * (height / 100.0))) >= 30 THEN 1 
        ELSE 0 
    END AS isObese 
FROM 
    patients;

SELECT 
    FLOOR(weight / 10) * 10 AS weight_group, 
    COUNT(*) AS total_patients 
FROM 
    patients 
GROUP BY 
    weight_group 
ORDER BY 
    weight_group DESC;

SELECT 
    MAX(daily_visits) AS max_visits, 
    MIN(daily_visits) AS min_visits, 
    ROUND(AVG(daily_visits), 2) AS average_visits 
FROM (
    SELECT 
        admission_date, 
        COUNT(*) AS daily_visits 
    FROM 
        admissions 
    GROUP BY 
        admission_date
) AS daily_counts;

SELECT 
    p.patient_id, 
    p.first_name, 
    p.last_name 
FROM 
    patients p 
LEFT JOIN 
    admissions a ON p.patient_id = a.patient_id 
WHERE 
    a.patient_id IS NULL;

SELECT 
    CONCAT(first_name, ' ', last_name) AS full_name, 
    ROUND(height / 30.48, 1) AS height_feet, 
    ROUND(weight * 2.205, 0) AS weight_pounds, 
    birth_date, 
    CASE 
        WHEN gender = 'F' THEN 'Female' 
        WHEN gender = 'M' THEN 'Male' 
        ELSE 'Other' 
    END AS gender 
FROM 
    patients;

SELECT 
    first_name, 
    last_name, 
    'Patient' AS role 
FROM 
    patients

UNION ALL

SELECT 
    first_name, 
    last_name, 
    'Doctor' AS role 
FROM 
    doctors;

SELECT 
    first_name, 
    last_name, 
    COUNT(*) AS duplicate_count 
FROM 
    patients 
GROUP BY 
    first_name, 
    last_name 
HAVING 
    COUNT(*) > 1;

SELECT 
    CONCAT(patients.first_name, ' ', patients.last_name) AS full_name, 
    admissions.diagnosis, 
    CONCAT(doctors.first_name, ' ', doctors.last_name) AS doctor_full_name 
FROM 
    patients 
JOIN 
    admissions ON patients.patient_id = admissions.patient_id 
JOIN 
    doctors ON admissions.attending_doctor_id = doctors.doctor_id;

SELECT 
    pn.province_name, 
    COUNT(p.patient_id) AS total_patients 
FROM 
    patients p
JOIN 
    province_names pn ON p.province_id = pn.province_id 
GROUP BY 
    pn.province_name 
ORDER BY 
    total_patients DESC;

SELECT 
    d.first_name, 
    d.last_name, 
    COUNT(a.patient_id) AS total_admissions 
FROM 
    doctors d 
LEFT JOIN 
    admissions a ON d.doctor_id = a.attending_doctor_id 
GROUP BY 
    d.doctor_id, d.first_name, d.last_name 
ORDER BY 
    total_admissions DESC;

SELECT 
    d.doctor_id, 
    CONCAT(d.first_name, ' ', d.last_name) AS full_name, 
    MIN(a.admission_date) AS first_admission_date, 
    MAX(a.admission_date) AS last_admission_date 
FROM 
    doctors d 
JOIN 
    admissions a ON d.doctor_id = a.attending_doctor_id 
GROUP BY 
    d.doctor_id, d.first_name, d.last_name;

editorText:
SELECT 
    d.doctor_id, 
    CONCAT(d.first_name, ' ', d.last_name) AS full_name, 
    MIN(a.admission_date) AS first_admission_date, 
    MAX(a.admission_date) AS last_admission_date 
FROM 
    doctors d 
JOIN 
    admissions a ON d.doctor_id = a.attending_doctor_id 
GROUP BY 
    d.doctor_id, d.first_name, d.last_name;
